articles.description: When the full-time whistle was blown in Sydney, it felt like the Lionesses' best opportunity to win a Women's World Cup had passed them by.
articles.title: Lionesses miss opportunity to cement legend status

articles.description: Katarina Johnson-Thompson claims a stunning heptathlon gold medal at the World Athletics Championships in Budapest.
articles.title: Johnson-Thompson wins stunning heptathlon world gold

articles.description: Watch the winning moment as Great Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson secures heptathlon gold in a thrilling 800m race.
articles.title: Johnson-Thompson wins heptathlon gold in 800m thriller

articles.description: Spain boss Jorge Vilda says his players are "eternal" and have a "star on their chest forever" after they defeat England to win the Fifa Women's World Cup.
articles.title: 'Unstoppable' Spain conquer world against the odds

articles.description: England's wait to win a first Women's World Cup goes on after defeat by Spain in the 2023 final in Sydney.
articles.title: Spain beat England to win the Women's World Cup

articles.description: West Ham United claim a London derby win against big-spending Chelsea despite Nayef Aguerd's red card midway through the second half.
articles.title: Ten-man West Ham claim rousing win against Chelsea

articles.description: Watch as Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes takes bronze in the men's 100m, while Noah Lyles of the United States wins gold.
articles.title: GB's Hughes takes bronze as Lyles wins 100m title

articles.description: Kilmarnock battle to an impressive 1-0 Viaplay Cup win over holders Celtic, inflicting a first cup loss for the Glasgow club under Brendan Rodgers.
articles.title: Rodgers' Celtic cup run over after Kilmarnock shock

articles.description: Watch Olga Carmona score the winner for Spain as they beat England 1-0 in the Women's World Cup final in Sydney.
articles.title: Watch: Carmona scores World Cup winner for Spain

articles.description: Everton manager Sean Dyche says he "could have taken his whole team off" during the 4-0 thrashing by Aston Villa.
articles.title: Dyche 'could have taken whole team off' in defeat
